alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Kiowa; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 9:25PM CDT until July 07 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Eastern Washita County in western Oklahoma... Southwestern Kingfisher County in central Oklahoma... Caddo County in southwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Custer County in western Oklahoma... Northeastern Kiowa County in southwestern Oklahoma... Blaine County in northwestern Oklahoma... Eastern Dewey County in northwestern Oklahoma... Western Canadian County in central Oklahoma... * Until 1030 PM CDT. * At 925 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles west of Oakwood to near Corn to 3 miles west of Gotebo, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Anadarko, Watonga, Hinton, Carnegie, Geary, Thomas, Hydro, Mountain View, Binger, Fort Cobb, Canton, Calumet, Corn, Cement, Custer City, Eakly, Gracemont, Gotebo, and Lookeba. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Caddo; Canadian; Custer; Dewey; Kingfisher; Kiowa; Washita
